**Credit Facilities Agreement**
**_Overview and Structure_**

In connection with the Financing of the Acquisition, Bidco will, on or prior to the Completion Date, enter into the Credit
Facilities Agreement with, among others, Barclays Bank PLC as agent (the “Senior Agent”) and Deutsche Bank AG, London
Branch as security agent (the “Security Agent”), and Barclays Bank PLC, Barclays Bank Ireland PLC, BNP Paribas, Credit
Suisse AG, London Branch, Credit Suisse (Deutschland) Aktiengesellschaft, Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft, UBS AG
London Branch, Crédit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank, Sucursal en España, UniCredit Bank AG, MUFG Bank
(Europe) N.V. and Coӧperatieve Rabobank U.A. as mandated lead arrangers (the “Mandated Lead Arrangers”). The Credit
Facilities Agreement will provide for committed facilities in the following amounts:

 - a €1,175.0 million senior secured term loan B facility (the “Term Loan B Facility”); and

 - a €275.0 million senior secured multi-currency revolving credit facility (the “Revolving Credit Facility” and, together
with Term Loan B Facility, the “Senior Facilities”).

Term Loan B Facility may be utilized by Bidco and may be used (directly or indirectly) (i) to finance or refinance amounts
payable in connection with the Acquisition, (ii) to finance or refinance the payment of any fees, costs, taxes and expenses
related to or incurred or charged in connection with the Acquisition, (iii) to refinance any existing indebtedness of the Target
Group, together with any associated fees, costs, taxes and expenses and/or (iv) for any other purpose contemplated by the tax
structure memorandum or the funds flow statement prepared by Bidco.

The Revolving Credit Facility may be utilized by Bidco and certain members of the TLB Group (for the purposes of the Credit
Facilities Agreement, the “TLB Group” consists of Bidco and its subsidiaries from time to time, but excluding Unrestricted
Subsidiaries (under and as defined in the Credit Facilities Agreement)) who accede as additional borrowers in euros, sterling,
U.S. dollars and certain other currencies readily available in the relevant interbank market by the drawing of cash advances,
the issue of bank guarantees, standby letters of credit and ancillary and fronted ancillary facilities. The Revolving Credit Facility
may be used (directly or indirectly) for the TLB Group’s working capital and general corporate purposes, including, without
limitation, the refinancing and repayment of existing revolving credit or other workin§ g capital debt and the funding of (i)
capital expenditures, (ii) acquisitions and investments (other than the Acquisition), (iii) operational restructurings and
reorganisations of the TLB Group, (iv) payments (including made to vendors) in respect of working capital relating to or arising
in connection with any acquisition (including the Acquisition), (v) payment of transaction costs, tax, OID, fees (including any
ticking fees), flex and other financing costs, including VAT thereon and/or (vi) any other purpose contemplated by the tax
structure memorandum and the funds flow statement prepared by Bidco.

In addition to Term Loan B Facility and the Revolving Credit Facility, the Credit Facilities Agreement includes the ability to
incur additional indebtedness (including under one or more additional facilities documented within or outside of the Credit
Facilities Agreement and/or additional Notes and/or other notes) up to an aggregate principal amount equal to the greater of
€270 million and 100% of consolidated pro forma EBITDA (as defined in the Credit Facilities Agreement), plus the aggregate
amount of all prepayments of the Senior Facilities and any Senior Secured Indebtedness, debt buy backs, any repayment
following the exercise of “yank the bank” and any other commitment reductions in respect of the Senior Facilities, plus an
unlimited amount, provided that, pro forma for the incurrence of such indebtedness: (i) if such indebtedness constitutes senior
secured liabilities under the Intercreditor Agreement, the Group’s consolidated senior secured net leverage ratio would not
exceed 4.75:1 or, if incurred in connection with a permitted acquisition or other permitted investment, the Group’s consolidated
senior secured net leverage ratio in effect immediately prior thereto; or (ii) if such indebtedness does not constitute senior
secured liabilities under the Intercreditor Agreement, the Group’s fixed charge cover ratio would be at least 2.00:1 or the
Group’s total net leverage ratio would not exceed 6.25x or, in either case, if incurred in connection with a permitted acquisition
or other permitted investment, the Group’s fixed charge cover ratio or total net leverage ratio, as applicable, in effect
immediately prior thereto, in each case, subject to certain other conditions being met.

The Credit Facilities Agreement will also require that certain creditors in respect of secured and unsecured indebtedness
permitted to be incurred under the Credit Facilities Agreement, including pursuant to certain ratio tests and baskets, will be
required to accede to the Intercreditor Agreement to the extent such indebtedness exceeds certain agreed thresholds.


-----

_Availability_

The Term Loan B Facility will be available on and from the date of the Credit Facilities Agreement up to the earlier of: (a) 6
December 2021 or, if earlier, the date which is ten (10) Business Days after the date that is the Longstop Date (as defined in
the Acquisition Agreement, as such date may be extended from time to time with the consent of all the Mandated Lead
Arrangers) or such later date as may be agreed by the Senior Agent (acting on the instructions of all the lenders under the Credit
Facilities Agreement), (b) the date on which Bidco (or KPS) notifies the Mandated Lead Arrangers in writing that the
Acquisition Agreement is terminated by either party thereto in accordance with its terms and (c) the Completion Date.

The Revolving Credit Facility may be utilized from the date of the Credit Facilities Agreement until the date which is one
month prior to the maturity date applicable to the Revolving Credit Facility.

_Interest and Fees_

Loans under the Credit Facilities Agreement will bear interest at a variable rate per annum. For loans denominated in dollars,
the rate will be based on the London Interbank Offer Rate (“LIBOR”) until switching on 31 December 2021 to the Secured
Overnight Financing Rate (“SOFR”) administered by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York. For loans denominated in
Sterling or euro, the rate will be based on the Sterling Over Night Index Average Rate (“SONIA”) or the Euro Interbank
Offered Rate (“EURIBOR”) respectively. In each case, an applicable margin will be added to the interest rate, which (following
the first full fiscal quarter commencing after the Completion Date) will be subject to a decreasing margin ratchet based on the
Group’s consolidated senior secured net leverage ratio. In addition, the margin applicable to Loans under the Term Loan B
Facility will be subject to a sustainability margin ratchet based on certain key performance indicators in respect of the TLB
Group’s results of operation which is expected to commence in 2022 on or or around the date of the delivery to the Senior
Agent of the Non-Financial Annual Report, as further described in the definitive documentation for the Term Loan B Facility.

If LIBOR, SOFR, SONIA or EURIBOR is less than zero, LIBOR, SOFR, SONIA or EURIBOR (as the case may be) shall be
deemed to be zero in respect of Term Loan B Facility loans and Revolving Credit Facility loans.

A commitment fee will be payable on the aggregate undrawn and uncancelled amount of the Revolving Credit Facility from
the date of first utilization of the Senior Facilities to the end of the availability period applicable to the Revolving Credit Facility
at a rate of 30% of the applicable margin for the Revolving Credit Facility. Commitment fees will be payable quarterly in
arrear, on the last date of the availability period applicable to the Revolving Credit Facility and, if cancelled in full, on the
cancelled amount of the relevant lender’s commitment at the time the cancellation becomes effective.

Default interest will be calculated as an additional 1% on the defaulted amount.

_Repayments_

Term Loan B Facility will be repaid in full on the date that is seven years from the Completion Date. In respect of the Revolving
Credit Facility, each advance will be repaid on the last day of the interest period relating thereto, subject to an ability to roll
over cash drawings. All outstanding amounts under the Revolving Credit Facility will be repaid on the date falling six and a
half years from the Completion Date. Amounts repaid by the borrowers on loans made under the Revolving Credit Facility
may be reborrowed, subject to certain conditions being met.

The Credit Facilities Agreement will contain a “soft call” whereby lenders under Term Loan B Facility will, subject to
customary carve-outs and exceptions, benefit from a prepayment fee of 1% if Term Loan B Facility is voluntarily refinanced
or amended pursuant to a refinancing transaction (other than in connection with any transaction that would constitute a change
of control, initial public offering or other transformative acquisition) within 6 months of first utilization of the Senior Facilities,
the primary purpose of which is reduce the yield on Term Loan B Facility.

_Voluntary and Mandatory Prepayments_

The Credit Facilities Agreement will permit voluntary prepayments to be made (subject to certain restrictions on the number
of voluntary prepayments permitted to be made and de minimis amounts) and will require mandatory prepayment in full or in
part in certain circumstances, including:

     - on a change of control or an initial public offering which results in a change of control, subject to an individual
lender put option at par;

     - from certain excess proceeds received by Bidco or any guarantor under the Term Loan B Facility from certain asset
disposals, to the extent required to be applied in prepayment of the Senior Facilities and subject to (i) step-downs
based on the Group’s total net leverage ratio and (ii) certain de minimis amounts; and


-----

     - for each financial year (commencing with the first full financial year commencing after the Completion Date), a
percentage of excess cash flow, subject to (i) step-downs based on the Group’s consolidated senior secured net
leverage ratio and (ii) certain de minimis amounts.

_Guarantees and Security_

Subject to certain agreed security principles and the terms of the Credit Facilities Agreement, the Senior Facilities will benefit
from guarantees and security from certain members of the TLB Group incorporated in The Netherlands, England & Wales,
France, Germany, Italy and Spain which will be limited by reference to certain legal and tax issues.

_Representations and Warranties_

The Credit Facilities Agreement will contain certain representations and warranties (subject to certain agreed qualifications
and with certain representations being repeated), including:

     - status, binding obligations, non-conflict with other obligations, power and authority, validity and admissibility in
evidence, governing law and enforcement, consents, fillings and laws applicable to operations and pari passu
ranking;

     - no insolvency, no litigation, environmental laws, taxation liabilities and filing and stamp taxes;

     - no default, financial statements, non-financial annual reports, group structure, the information memorandum, base
case model and reports;

     - no security, guarantees or financial indebtedness, except as permitted;

     - intellectual property, legal and beneficial ownership in relation to material assets and shares fully paid;

     - acquisition documents containing all material terms;

     - limitations on holding company activities; and

     - centre of main interests and compliance with sanctions and anti-corruption laws.

Certain representations and warranties will be made on the date of the Credit Facilities Agreement and first utilization of the
Senior Facilities and repeated on the date of each utilization, on the first day of each interest period and at certain other times.

_Covenants_

The Credit Facilities Agreement will contain certain incurrence covenants, information undertakings and related definitions
consistent with the those applicable to the Notes (with, in each case, certain adjustments), including (i) limitations on
indebtedness and issuance of disqualified stock and preferred stock; (ii) limitations on restricted payments; (iii) limitations on
liens; (iv) limitations on sale of assets and subsidiary stock; (v) limitations on affiliate transactions; (vi) designation of restricted
and Unrestricted Subsidiaries; (vii) restrictions on merger and consolidation of Bidco and guarantors; (viii) additional
intercreditor agreements; (ix) limitation on restrictions on the payment of dividends or certain other classes of intra-Group
transactions; (x) restriction on impairment of security interests; and (xi) a restriction on the activities of the Issuer.

In addition, the Credit Facilities Agreement will also require Bidco and certain of its restricted subsidiaries to observe certain
other customary positive and negative covenants, subject to customary and other exceptions and qualifications, including
covenants relating to (i) the provision of financial statements and certain other information; (ii) authorizations and consents;
(iii) maintenance of status and authorization; (iv) pari passu ranking; (v) insurances; (vi) taxes; (vii) access to certain financial
information (where certain events of default are continuing); (viii) enforcement of rights under the Acquisition agreement; (ix)
intellectual property; (x) environmental laws; (xi) acquisition documents; (xii) provision of guarantees and security and further
assurance; (xiii) centre of main interests; (xiv) reasonable endeavors to maintain a rating (but not a specific rating) and (xv)
compliance with sanctions and anti-corruption laws.

Solely for the benefit of the lenders participating in the Revolving Credit Facility, the Credit Facilities Agreement will require
that, in the event that the aggregate amount of all utilizations under the Revolving Credit Facility (excluding any utilizations
by way of letters of credit, bank guarantees or ancillary facilities or any amounts utilized to fund any
original issue discount or up-front fees incurred in connection with the syndication of the Senior Facilities) exceeds an agreed
percentage of the total commitments under the Revolving Credit Facility on the relevant testing date, the Group’s consolidated
senior secured net leverage ratio does not exceed an agreed ratio. The financial covenant will be subject to an equity cure
regime.


-----

It is intended that certain agreed covenants and other provisions of the Credit Facilities Agreement will fall away on the
satisfaction of certain release conditions, being (i) the occurrence of a listing in respect of which the Group’s consolidated total
net leverage ratio is equal to or less than an agreed ratio or (ii) any member of the TLB Group or any parent holding company
having a long-term corporate credit rating equal to or better than Baa3 according to Moody’s or BBB- according to S&P’s.

_Events of Default_

The Credit Facilities Agreement will provide for substantially consistent events of default as under the Notes, the occurrence
of which would allow, unless otherwise indicated below, the majority (being 50.1%) of the lenders under the Credit Facilities
Agreement to accelerate all outstanding loans and terminate their commitments (subject in certain cases to agreed grace periods,
financial thresholds, cure rights, clean-up periods and other qualifications) including (i) breach of the financial covenant,
provided that (A) in the event of such breach, only the majority lenders under the Revolving Credit Facility may exercise
acceleration rights as a result of such breach and (B) if the majority lenders under the Revolving Credit Facility have exercised
such acceleration rights as a result of such breach, the remaining lenders shall have a right of cross-acceleration;
(ii) misrepresentation; (iii) invalidity and unlawfulness of the Credit Facilities financing documents; (iv) repudiation and
recession of the Credit Facilities financing documents; (v) breach of material obligations under the Credit Facilities financing
documents; and (vi) material failure to comply with the Intercreditor Agreement.

**Intercreditor Agreement**

**_General_**

To establish the relative rights of certain of the Group’s creditors under our financing arrangements, Bidco, each of the
Guarantors (together with any other entity which accedes to the Intercreditor Agreement as a debtor, (the “Debtors”)) and the
Issuer will enter into the Intercreditor Agreement with, among others, the Security Agent and the Senior Agent. On or about
the Issue Date, the Trustee in respect of the Notes will become party to the Intercreditor Agreement. The Intercreditor
Agreement is governed by English law and sets out, among other things, the relative ranking of certain debt of the Debtors,
when payments can be made in respect of debt of the Debtors, when enforcement action can be taken in respect of that debt,
the terms pursuant to which certain of that debt will be subordinated upon the occurrence of certain insolvency events and
turnover provisions.

By accepting a Note, the relevant holder thereof shall be deemed to have agreed to, and accepted the terms and conditions of,
the Intercreditor Agreement. The following description is a summary of certain provisions contained in the Intercreditor
Agreement which relate to the rights and obligations of the holders of the Notes. It does not restate the Intercreditor Agreement
in its entirety. As such, you are urged to read the Intercreditor Agreement because it, and not the discussion that follows, defines
certain rights of the holders of the Notes. Capitalized terms used but not defined in the Certain Definitions section herein have
the meanings given to them in the Intercreditor Agreement.

**Liabilities”), any liabilities of any holder of Senior Secured Notes (a “Senior Secured Noteholder”) or the trustee**
or Security Agent in respect of Senior Secured Notes (a “Senior Secured Notes Finance Party” and such liabilities


-----

the “Senior Secured Notes Liabilities”), the liabilities in relation to certain permitted hedging (the “Hedging
**Liabilities”), the liabilities in relation to certain permitted bilateral facilities (the “Bilateral Facility Liabilities”,**

**Liabilities”), amounts due to a trustee of any Senior Secured Notes, amounts due to a trustee of any Second Lien**

holding company or affiliate of any member of the Senior Subordinated Group or a joint venture) for the purposes of the Debt
Documents.

“Senior Subordinated Notes Collateral” refers to the share security granted by Topco over its shares in the Issuer, security
granted by Topco over any receivables owed to Topco by any member of the Group in respect of any shareholder loan and
security granted by the Issuer over its material bank accounts and any other document designated as such by Topco and the
Independent Security Agent so long as such security is not granted by a member of the ICA Group or over shares or equivalent
ownership interests in any member of the ICA Group, in each case which is created, or expressed to be created, in favor of the
Independent Security Agent as agent or trustee for the other Senior Subordinated Secured Parties (or if such security agency or
trustee arrangements are not legally possible, in favor of all the Senior Subordinated Secured Parties or in favor of the
Independent Security Agent under a parallel debt or similar structure).

“Common Collateral” refers to security which is created, or expressed to be created, in favor of the Common Security Agent
as agent or trustee for the other Secured Parties in respect of the liabilities owed to them by a member of the Senior Subordinated
Group, in the case of the Senior Subordinated Facility Liabilities or the Senior Subordinated Notes Liabilities, or otherwise, by
a member of the ICA Group, in each case under the Debt Documents (or if such security agency or trustee arrangements are
not legally possible, in favor of all the Secured Parties or in favor of the Common Security Agent under a parallel debt or
similar structure), so long as such collateral is not Senior Subordinated Notes Collateral.

The Senior Subordinated Notes Collateral shall rank and secure the following liabilities in the following order:

     - first, the liabilities owed to the security agent in respect of the Senior Subordinated Notes Collateral, (the
“Independent Security Agent”) amounts due to any facility agent under a Senior Subordinated Facility and
amounts due to the Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee pari passu and without any preference between them; and

     - second, the liabilities owed to any creditor under a Senior Subordinated Facility (the “Senior Subordinated
**Facility Liabilities”) and the liabilities owed to any Senior Subordinated Noteholder (the “Senior Subordinated**
**Notes Liabilities”) pari passu and without any preference between them.**

The Common Collateral shall rank and secure the following liabilities (only to the extent that such security is expressed to
secure the relevant liabilities) in the following order:

     - first, the liabilities owed to the security agent in respect of the Common Collateral (the “Common Security
**Agent”) and to the Senior Agent (the “Senior Agent Liabilities”), amounts due to a trustee of any Senior Secured**
Notes (the “Senior Secured Notes Trustee Amounts”), amounts due to any facility agent under a Second Lien
Facility (the “Second Lien Agent Liabilities”), amounts due to a trustee of any Second Lien Notes (the “Second
**Lien Notes Trustee Amounts”), amounts due to any facility agent under a Senior Subordinated Facility (the**


-----

“Senior Subordinated Agent Liabilities”) and amounts due to the Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee (the
“Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee Amounts”), pari passu and without any preference between them;

     - second, the Senior Lender Liabilities, the Bilateral Facility Liabilities, the Senior Secured Notes Liabilities and the
Hedging Liabilities pari passu and without any preference between them; and

     - third, the Second Lien Lender Liabilities and the Second Lien Notes Liabilities pari passu and without any
preference between them; and

     - fourth, the Senior Subordinated Guarantee Liabilities pari passu and without any preference between them.

_Second Lien Liabilities and security_

The Second Lien Liabilities owed (if any) by a Second Lien Issuer/Borrower (to the extent relating to Liabilities in respect of
Second Lien Notes and/or any Second Lien Facility Agreement where that Second Lien Issuer/Borrower is the issuer or, as the
case may be, the borrower of such Liabilities) are senior obligations of that Second Lien Issuer/Borrower. The Second Lien
Liabilities are entitled to benefit from certain security including the Common Collateral and certain types of Security that the
finance documents in respect of the Senior Secured Liabilities (the “Senior Secured Finance Documents”) contemplate may
be granted to the Second Lien Creditors without also being offered to the Senior Secured Creditors (defined below).

Notwithstanding the above paragraph, until the Senior Discharge Date (defined below), the Second Lien Creditors may not
take any steps to appropriate the assets of a Second Lien Issuer/Borrower subject to the Security Documents in connection with
any Enforcement Action, other than as expressly permitted by the Intercreditor Agreement.

“Second Lien Issuer/Borrower” means the member of the ICA Group which is the issuer of any Second Lien Notes, or, as
the case may be, borrower under any Second Lien Facility Agreement which complies with certain other restrictions set out in
the Intercreditor Agreement as to being an entity which:

(a) is not liable in respect of certain Senior Secured Creditor Liabilities (defined below); or

(b) meets certain criteria as to being a special purpose financing vehicle.

_Intra-Group Liabilities, Senior Subordinated Notes Liabilities, Investor Liabilities and Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan_

_Liabilities_

The Intercreditor Agreement will provide that:

     - the intra-group liabilities of the Debtors to another member of the ICA Group are postponed and subordinated to
the liabilities owed by the Debtors or any Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower to the Secured Creditors; and

     - the liabilities owed to Topco or any holding company of Topco under any agreement providing a loan (other than
the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan) from Topco or any holding company of Topco to the Issuer or a subsidiary
of the Issuer or for any amounts to be paid by a member of the Senior Subordinated Group to Topco or any holding
company of Topco (the “Investor Liabilities”), and the liabilities under any Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan
made from a Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower to Bidco for the purposes of on-lending the proceeds of the
Senior Subordinated Notes or a loan under a Senior Subordinated Facility (a “Senior Subordinated Proceeds
**Loan” and the “Senior Subordinated** **Proceeds Loan Liabilities”) are postponed and subordinated to the**
liabilities owed by the Debtors to the Secured Creditors and the intra-group lenders.

**_Restrictions Relating to Senior Secured Creditor Liabilities_**

The Issuer and the Debtors may make payment on the Senior Lender Liabilities, the Bilateral Facility Liabilities and the Senior
Secured Notes Liabilities (together, the “Senior Secured Creditor Liabilities”) at any time, provided that following a Senior
Distress Event which is continuing, payments may only be made by Debtors and received by creditors which is continuing in
accordance with the provisions described under the caption “—Application of Proceeds.”

The Intercreditor Agreement will provide that the Senior Secured Creditors, the Issuer, the Third Party Security Providers and
the Debtors may at any time amend or waive any of the terms of the Senior Secured Finance Documents in accordance with
their respective terms from time to time (and subject only to any consent required under them).


-----

_Security and Guarantees: Senior Secured Creditors_

The Senior Lenders, the holders of any Senior Secured Notes (and/or any person acting on behalf of them), the Bilateral Lender
and the Hedge Counterparties (the “Senior Secured Creditors”) may take, accept or receive the benefit of:

     - any security from any member of the ICA Group in respect of any of the Senior Secured Creditor Liabilities, in
addition to the Common Collateral provided that (with certain exceptions for security granted to ancillary lenders,
issuing banks and bilateral facility lenders) and to the extent legally possible and subject to certain agreed security
principles, at the same time, it is also offered either:

           - to the Common Security Agent for the Secured Parties (as defined below) other than the Senior
Subordinated Creditors (the “Priority Secured Parties”) in respect of their liabilities; or

           - in the case of any jurisdiction in which effective security cannot be granted in favor of the Common Security
Agent or trustee for the Priority Secured Parties:

               - to the other Priority Secured Parties in respect of their liabilities; or

               - to the Common Security Agent under a parallel debt structure, or attorney-in-fact structure for the
benefit of the other Priority Secured Parties,

and ranks in the same order of priority as set out under the caption “—Priority of Security,” provided that
all amounts actually received or recovered by any Senior Secured Creditors with respect to any such
security shall immediately be paid to the Common Security Agent and held and applied in accordance with
the provisions set out under the caption “—Application of Proceeds”;

     - any guarantee, indemnity or other assurance against loss from any member of the ICA Group regarding the Senior
Lender Liabilities or the Senior Secured Notes Liabilities or the Bilateral Facility Liabilities (the “Senior Secured
**Creditor Liabilities”), in addition to those in:**

           - the original form of the Credit Facilities Agreement, any Bilateral Facility Document or any other facility
agreement or indenture permitted under the Intercreditor Agreement which evidences Senior Lender
Liabilities or any Senior Secured Note Liabilities;

           - the Intercreditor Agreement; or

          - any guarantee, indemnity or other assurance against loss in respect of any of the liabilities, the benefit of
which (however conferred) is, to the extent legally possible and subject to certain agreed security principles,
given to or expressed to be given to all the Secured Parties in respect of their liabilities;
_provided that, if and to the extent legally possible, (with certain exceptions for security granted to ancillary_
lenders, issuing banks or bilateral facility lenders) and subject to certain agreed security principles, at the
same time it is also offered to the other Priority Secured Parties in respect of their liabilities, and ranks in
the same order of priority as set out under the caption “—Ranking and Priority” and all amounts received
by any Senior Secured Creditor with respect to such guarantee, indemnity or other assurance against loss
are immediately paid to the Common Security Agent and applied in accordance with the provisions set out
under the caption “—Application of Proceeds.”

     - any Security, guarantee, indemnity or other assurance against loss from any member of the ICA Group in
connection with:

           - any escrow or similar or equivalent arrangements entered into in respect of amounts which are being held
(or will be held) by a person which is not a member of the ICA Group prior to release of those amounts to
a member of the ICA Group; or

           - any actual or proposed defeasance, redemption, prepayment, repayment, purchase or other discharge of any
Senior Lender Liabilities, Senior Secured Notes Liabilities and/or liabilities under any Permitted Senior
Secured Facilities Agreement (in each case provided that such defeasance, redemption, prepayment,
repayment, purchase or other discharge is not prohibited by the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement).

**_Restriction on Enforcement: Senior Secured Creditors_**

The Intercreditor Agreement will provide that the Senior Secured Creditors may not take action specified in paragraphs (iii),
(iv) or (v) of the definition of Enforcement Action below without the prior written consent of an Instructing Group (as defined
below).


-----

An “Instructing Group” means at any time:

     - prior to the first date on which all Senior Secured Liabilities have been discharged (the “Senior Secured Discharge
**Date”), the Majority Senior Secured Creditors;**

     - on or after the Senior Secured Discharge Date but before the first date on which all Second Lien Liabilities have
been discharged (the “Second Lien Discharge Date”), the Majority Second Lien Creditors; and

     - on or after the later to occur of the Senior Secured Discharge Date and the Second Lien Discharge Date (the
“Priority Discharge Date”) but before the first date the Senior Subordinated Notes Liabilities and the Senior
Subordinated Facility Liabilities have been discharged (the “Senior Subordinated Discharge Date”), the
Majority Senior Subordinated Creditors.

“Majority Second Lien Creditors” means, at any time when (i) there are no Second Lien Notes Liabilities outstanding, Second
Lien Creditors whose Second Lien Credit Participations aggregate more than 66[2]⁄3% of the total Second Lien Credit
Participations at that time; and (ii) there are Second Lien Notes Liabilities outstanding, Second Lien Lenders and Second Lien
Noteholders whose Second Lien Credit Participations aggregate more than 50% of the total Second Lien Credit Participations
at that time.

“Majority Senior Secured Creditors” means, at any time, when (i) there are no Senior Secured Notes Liabilities outstanding,
Senior Lenders and certain hedge counterparties whose Senior Credit Participations aggregate more than 66[2]⁄3% of the total
Senior Credit Participations at that time; and (ii) there are Senior Secured Notes Liabilities outstanding, Senior Lenders, Senior
Secured Noteholders and certain hedge counterparties whose Senior Credit Participations aggregate more than 50% of the total
Senior Credit Participations at that time.

“Majority Senior Subordinated Creditors” means, at any time when (i) there are no Senior Subordinated Notes Liabilities
outstanding, those Senior Subordinated Creditors whose Senior Subordinated Credit Participations aggregate more than 66[2]⁄3%
of the total Senior Subordinated Credit Participations at that time; and (ii) there are Senior Subordinated Notes Liabilities
outstanding, those Senior Subordinated Creditors whose Senior Subordinated Credit Participations aggregate more than 50%
of the total Senior Subordinated Credit Participations at that time.

“Second Lien Credit Participations” refers to drawn and undrawn commitments under Second Lien Facilities and the
principal amount of outstanding Second Lien Notes held by a Second Lien Noteholder.

“Senior Credit Participations” refers to drawn and undrawn commitments under the Permitted Senior Secured Facilities,
amounts payable for terminated or closed out hedging obligations and amounts that would be payable in respect of hedging
obligations if they were terminated or closed out at that time.

“Senior Subordinated Credit Participations” refers to drawn and undrawn commitments under Senior Subordinated
Facilities and the principal amount of outstanding Senior Subordinated Notes held by a Senior Subordinated Noteholder.

**_Restrictions Relating to Second Lien Liabilities_**

The Intercreditor Agreement contains provisions governing permitted payments of Second Lien Liabilities and the various
circumstances in which Second Lien Creditors (defined below) may take enforcement action prior to the Senior Secured
Discharge Date. On the Completion Date, no Second Lien Liabilities will have been incurred by the ICA Group.

Prior to the Senior Secured Discharge Date, the members of the ICA Group may only make payments in respect of the Second
Lien Liabilities, in accordance with the finance documents governing such Second Lien Liabilities, subject to compliance with
certain conditions in the Intercreditor Agreement which are broadly similar to those applying the Senior Subordinated Notes.
The principal conditions are that the relevant payment is not prohibited by the Credit Facilities Agreement (or any other facility
agreement evidencing Senior Lender Liabilities) or any Senior Secured Notes Indenture (or if it is so prohibited, the required
consent has been obtained), no payment stop notice has been issued to the Second Lien Agent or the trustee in respect of any
Second Lien Notes (the “Second Lien Notes Trustee”), and no Senior Secured Payment Default (defined below) is continuing.


-----

**_Restrictions Relating to Senior Subordinated Notes_**

_Restriction on Payment and Dealings_

The Intercreditor Agreement will provide that, until the Priority Discharge Date, the Debtors shall not (and shall ensure that no
member of the ICA Group will):

(i) pay, repay, prepay, redeem, acquire or defease any principal, interest or other amount on or in respect of, or make any
distribution in respect of, any Senior Subordinated Guarantee Liabilities or Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan
Liabilities (together, “Senior SubordinatedGroup Liabilities”) in cash or in kind or apply any such money or property
in or towards discharge of any such liabilities except as permitted by the provisions set out below under the captions “—
Permitted Senior Subordinated Payments,” “—Permitted Senior Subordinated Enforcement,” and the ninth paragraph
under the caption “—Effect of Insolvency Event; Filing of Claims”;

(ii) exercise any set-off against any Senior Subordinated Guarantee Liabilities or Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan
Liabilities, except as permitted by the provisions set out in the caption “—Permitted Senior Subordinated Payments”
below, the provisions set out in the caption “—Restrictions on Senior Subordinated Enforcement” below or the ninth
paragraph under the caption “—Effect of Insolvency Event; Filing of Claims” below;

(iii) create or permit to subsist any security guarantee, indemnity or other assurance against loss from (or over any assets of
or shares in) any member of the ICA Group or give any guarantee (and the Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee and the
agent under a Senior Subordinated Facility may not, and no creditor in respect of Senior Subordinated Notes or a Senior
Subordinated Facility (together the “Senior Subordinated Creditors”) may accept, the benefit of any such security or
guarantee, indemnity or other assurance against loss) from any member of the ICA Group for, or in respect of, any Senior
Subordinated Facility Liabilities or Senior Subordinated Notes Liabilities (together, “Senior Subordinated Liabilities”)
or Senior Subordinated Guarantee Liabilities other than certain security including (i) in connection with any escrow or
similar or equivalent arrangements entered into in respect of amounts which are being held (or will be held) by a person
which is not a member of the ICA Group prior to release of those amounts or (ii) the Parent Common Transaction
Security; or (iii) certain forms of security that the Senior Secured Finance Documents contemplate may be granted to the
Senior Subordinated Creditors without being offered to the Senior Secured Creditors; or

(iv) create or permit to subsist any Security, guarantee indemnity or other assurance against loss from (or over any assets of
or shares in) any member of the Group or give any guarantee, and no Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower may take,
accept or receive the benefit of any Security, guarantee, indemnity or other assistance against loss from any member of
the Group for, or in respect of, the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities, unless that Security, guarantee,
indemnity or other assurance against loss is not prohibited by the Prior Ranking Finance Agreements or, to the extent
prohibited, the Required Consent has been obtained.

_Permitted Senior Subordinated Payments_

Prior to the Priority Discharge Date, any member of the ICA Group may make payments to the Senior Subordinated Creditors
(in respect of the Senior Subordinated Guarantee Liabilities) or the Issuer (in respect of the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan
Liabilities only) then due in accordance with the finance documents in respect of the Senior Subordinated Facility or Senior
Subordinated Notes (the “Senior Subordinated Finance Documents”) or the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement
(such payments, collectively, “Permitted Senior SubordinatedPayments”):

(i) if:

(A) the payment is not prohibited by any prior ranking financing agreements (in respect of the Senior Secured
Liabilities and the Second Lien Liabilities), or any required consents to permit such payment has been obtained;

(B) no Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice (defined below) is outstanding; and

(C) no payment default under the Permitted Senior Secured Facilities, Bilateral Facility or the Senior Secured Notes (a
“Senior Secured Payment Default”), or under the Second Lien Facilities or Second Lien Notes (a “Second Lien
**Payment Default”) has occurred and is continuing; or**

(ii) if the payment is of certain amounts due to the Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee, or an agent under a Senior
Subordinated Facility in accordance with the original form of the Senior Subordinated Finance Documents under which
they are payable;

(iii) if the payment is of certain administration and maintenance costs, expenses and taxes of the Issuer (in acting as a holding
company of the Senior Subordinated Group and borrower or issuer of the Senior Subordinated Liabilities), including any
reporting or listing requirement and costs and expenses of any security agent in relation to the protection, preservation
or enforcement of such security;


-----

(iv) unless a Senior Acceleration Event or Senior Secured Notes Acceleration Event has occurred, if the payment is of any
amendment, consent and/or waiver fees and any related expenses incurred in respect of (or reasonably incidental to) the
Senior Subordinated Finance Documents (including in relation to any reporting or listing requirements thereunder) which
expressed as a percentage of the principal amount of the Senior Subordinated Group Liabilities (or the affected amount
thereof), does not exceed the amount of the corresponding consent and/or waiver fee paid to the Senior Secured Creditors
(when expressed as a percentage of the Senior Secured Liabilities (or the affected principal amount thereof));

(v) following the occurrence of a Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Event of Default which is continuing, if all or part of
the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities are released or otherwise discharged solely in consideration for the
issues of shares in the Issuer (each, a “Debt for Equity Swap”) provided that no cash or cash equivalent payment is
made in respect of the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities and any Liabilities owed by a member of the ICA
Group to another member of the ICA Group, the Investor or any other holding company of the Issuer that arise as a result
of any such Debt for Equity Swap are subordinated as Investor Liabilities pursuant to the Intercreditor Agreement and
the Senior Secured Creditors and Second Lien Creditors are granted security in respect of any of those Senior
Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities owed by the Issuer;

(vi) of any other amount not exceeding €1,000,000 (or its equivalent in other currencies) in aggregate in any twelve month
period; or

(vii) if the Majority Senior Secured Creditors and the Majority Second Lien Creditors give prior consent to that Payment being
made.

On or after the Priority Discharge Date, any member of the ICA Group may make payments to the Senior Subordinated
Creditors (in respect of the Senior Subordinated Guarantee Liabilities) or a Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower (in respect of
the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities only) then due in accordance with the Senior Subordinated Finance
Documents and Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement (as applicable).

_Payment Blockage Provisions_

Until the Priority Discharge Date, except with the Required Senior Consent, no Debtor shall make, (and the Issuer shall procure
that no other member of the ICA Group will make) and no Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower nor any Senior Subordinated
Creditor may receive from any member of the ICA Group, any Permitted Senior Subordinated Payment (other than Senior
Subordinated Agent Amounts) if:

(i) a Priority Payment Default is continuing; or

(ii) a Priority Event of Default (other than a Priority Payment Default) is continuing, from the date which is one Business
Day after the date on which the Common Security Agent (acting on the instructions of an Instructing Group) delivers a
notice (a “Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice”) specifying the event or circumstance in relation to that Priority
Event of Default to any Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower and the Senior Subordinated Creditor Representatives until
the earliest to occur of:

(A) the date falling 179 days after delivery of that Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice;

(B) in relation to payments of Senior Subordinated Group Liabilities, if a Senior Subordinated Standstill Period is in
effect at any time after delivery of that Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice, the date on which that Senior
Subordinated Standstill Period expires;

(C) the date on which the relevant Priority Event of Default has been remedied or waived in accordance with the
applicable Senior Secured Finance Documents or the Second Lien Finance Documents (as applicable);

(D) the date on which the Common Security Agent delivers a notice to each Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower and
the Senior Subordinated Creditor Representative(s) cancelling the Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice;

(E) the Priority Discharge Date; and

(F) the date on which the Common Security Agent or any Senior Creditor Representative or Second Lien creditor
representative takes Enforcement Action permitted under the Intercreditor Agreement against a Debtor.

Unless each of the Senior Subordinated Creditor Representatives and each Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower waives this
requirement:

(i) a new Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice may not be delivered unless and until 360 days have elapsed since the
delivery of the immediately prior Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice; and


-----

(ii) no Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice may be delivered by the Common Security Agent in reliance on a Priority
Event of Default more than 45 days after the date it received notice of that Priority Event of Default.

The Common Security Agent may only serve one Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice with respect to the same event or
set of circumstances. Subject to the paragraph above, this shall not affect the right of the Common Security Agent to issue a
Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice in respect of any other event or set of circumstances.

No Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice may be served by the Common Security Agent in respect of a Priority Event of
Default which had been notified to the Common Security Agent at the time at which an earlier Senior Subordinated Payment
Stop Notice was issued.

Any failure to make a payment due under the Senior Subordinated Finance Documents or Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan
Agreement as a result of the issue of a Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice or the occurrence of a Senior Secured Payment
Default or Second Lien Payment Default shall not prevent (i) the occurrence of an event of default as a consequence of that
failure to make a payment in relation to the relevant Senior Subordinated Finance Document or Senior Subordinated Proceeds
Loan Agreement; or (ii) the issue of an enforcement notice in respect of an event of default in respect of a Senior Subordinated
Facility or Senior Subordinated Notes (a “Senior Subordinated Enforcement Notice”) on behalf of the Senior Subordinated
Creditors.

_Payment Obligations and Capitalization of Interest Continue_

No Debtor shall be released from the liability to make any payment (including of default interest, which shall continue to
accrue) under any Senior Subordinated Finance Document or Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement by the operation
of the provisions set out under each section above under the caption “—Restrictions relating to Senior Subordinated Notes”
even if its obligation to make such payment is restricted at any time by the terms of any of those provisions.

The accrual and capitalization of interest (if any) in accordance with the Senior Subordinated Finance Documents or Senior
Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement shall continue notwithstanding the issue of a Senior Subordinated Payment Stop
Notice.

_Cure of Payment Stop_

If:

(i) at any time following the issue of a Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice or the occurrence of a Senior Secured
Payment Default or Second Lien Payment Default, that Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice ceases to be
outstanding and/or (as the case may be) the Senior Secured Payment Default or Second Lien Payment Default ceases to
be continuing; and

(ii) the relevant Debtor then promptly pays to the Senior Subordinated Creditors or the Issuer (in respect of the Senior
Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities only) an amount equal to any payments which had accrued under the Senior
Subordinated Finance Documents or the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement (as applicable) and which would
have been Permitted Senior Subordinated Payments but for that Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice or Senior
Secured Payment Default or Second Lien Payment Default (as the case may be),

then any Senior Subordinated Event of Default (including any cross default or similar provision under any other Debt
Document) which may have occurred as a result of that suspension of payments shall be waived and any Senior Subordinated
Enforcement Notice which may have been issued as a result of that Senior Subordinated Event of Default shall be waived, in
each case without any further action being required on the part of the Senior Subordinated Creditors or the Issuer (in respect of
the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities only).

_Restrictions on Amendments and Waivers_

Subject to the following paragraph, the Intercreditor Agreement will provide that the Senior Subordinated Creditors may amend
or waive the terms of the Senior Subordinated Finance Documents (other than the Intercreditor Agreement or any security
document) in accordance with their respective terms at any time, subject to any consent required under them provided that the
terms of the Senior Subordinated Finance Documents as so amended or waived are not prohibited by the terms of the Senior
Secured Finance Documents and the Second Lien Finance Document or if Required Creditor Consent is obtained.


-----

Prior to the Priority Discharge Date, the Issuer and any Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower may not amend or waive the
terms of the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement if such amendment or waiver would result in the Issuer being
subject to more onerous obligations than those contained in the relevant Senior Subordinated Finance Document (under which
the proceeds of the relevant Senior Subordinated Facility or Senior Subordinated Notes are borrowed or issued to be on-lent)
to which the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement relates. This restriction shall not apply if such amendment or
waiver relates to an increase in the applicable margin or coupon payable on the relevant Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan
Agreement (provided that such margin or coupon (as the case may be) may be higher than the margin or coupon payable on
the relevant Senior Subordinated Facility or Senior Subordinated Notes to which the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan
Agreement relates) to the extent it is customary for such Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement at the date of
borrowing or issuance thereunder, taking into account the then current market provided that to the extent it is necessary on the
basis of a determination made in good faith by the board of directors of the Issuer (for which it can conclusively rely on the
advice and feedback of its tax advisers).

_Restrictions on Enforcement by Senior Subordinated Finance Party_

Until the Priority Discharge Date, except with the prior consent of or as required by the Instructing Group:

(i) no Senior Subordinated Finance Party shall direct the Common Security Agent to enforce, or otherwise (to the extent
applicable) require the enforcement of, any Common Collateral; and

(ii) no Senior Subordinated Finance Party nor any Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower shall take or require the taking of
any Enforcement Action against a member of the ICA Group in relation to the Senior Subordinated Group Liabilities,

except as permitted under the provisions set out under the caption “—Permitted Senior Subordinated Enforcement” below,
_provided, however, that no such action required by an Instructing Group need be taken except to the extent such Instructing_
Group otherwise is entitled under the Intercreditor Agreement to direct such action.

Any Senior Subordinated Creditor may at any time take any Enforcement Action against a Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower
or any guarantor of Senior Subordinated Liabilities which is not a member of the ICA Group in each case in each case in
accordance with the Senior Subordinated Finance Documents.

“Enforcement Action” is defined as:

(i) in relation to any liabilities:

     - the acceleration of any liabilities or the making of any declaration that any liabilities are prematurely due and
payable (other than as a result of it becoming unlawful for a Senior Lender, a holder of Senior Secured Notes, a
Second Lien Lender, a Second Lien Noteholder, a Senior Subordinated Lender or a holder of Senior Subordinated
Notes to perform its obligations under, or of any voluntary or mandatory prepayment arising under, any of the Debt
Documents);

      - the making of any declaration that any liabilities are payable on demand;

     - the making of a demand in relation to a liability that is payable on demand;

     - the making of any demand against any member of the ICA Group in relation to any guarantee liabilities of that
member of the ICA Group;

     - the exercise of any right to require any member of the ICA Group to acquire any liability (including exercising any
put or call option against any member of the ICA Group for the redemption or purchase of any liability but
excluding any such right which arises as a result of the permitted debt purchase transactions provisions of the
Credit Facilities Agreement (or any similar or equivalent provision of any other facility agreement documenting
Senior Lender Liabilities other than the Credit Facilities Agreement and which is permitted by the Intercreditor
Agreement (a “Permitted Senior Secured Facility Agreement”), the Senior Secured Notes finance documents, a
Second Lien Facility Agreement, Second Lien Notes finance documents, a Senior Subordinated Facility Agreement
or the Senior Subordinated Notes finance documents and excluding any mandatory offer arising as a result of a
change of control or asset sale (however described) as set out in the finance documents relating to the Senior
Secured Notes, Second Lien Notes or Senior Subordinated Notes) (or any other similar or equivalent provision of
any Permitted Senior Secured Facilities Agreements, the Senior Secured Notes finance documents, a Second Lien
Facility Agreement, the Second Lien Notes Finance Documents, the Senior Subordinated Facility Agreement or
the Senior Subordinated Notes Finance Documents;

     - the exercise of any right of set-off, account combination or payment netting against any member of the ICA Group

           - as close-out netting by a hedge counterparty or by a hedging ancillary lender or by a hedging bilateral

           - as payment netting by a hedge counterparty or by a hedging ancillary lender or by a hedging bilateral
facility lender;

          - as inter-hedging agreement netting by a hedge counterparty;

          - as inter-hedging ancillary document netting by a hedging ancillary lender;

          - as inter-hedging Bilateral Facility Document Netting by a hedging bilateral facility lender; and

Agreement, Senior Secured Notes Finance Documents, a Second Lien Facility Agreement, Second Lien
Notes Finance Documents, a Senior Subordinated Facility Agreement or the Senior Subordinated Notes

payment under the Intercreditor Agreement; and

     - the suing for, commencing or joining of any legal or arbitration proceedings against any member of the Senior

(ii) the premature termination or close-out of any hedging transaction under any hedging agreement (except to the extent

(iii) the taking of any steps to enforce or require the enforcement of any security (including the crystallization of any floating

(v) the petitioning, applying or voting for, or the taking of any steps (including the appointment of any liquidator, receiver,

indebtedness of any such member of the Senior Subordinated Group, or any analogous procedure or step in any

except that the following shall not constitute Enforcement Action:

     - the taking of any action falling above which is necessary (but only to the extent necessary) to preserve the validity,

     - unless an acceleration event is continuing, a demand made by (i) Topco or the Issuer or any other person which

not diluted as a result and provided further that (in any such case) in the event that the shares of such member of
